q: In an operating system, consider a list of processes assumed to have arrived at time 0, in the order P0, P1,..., P4, with running times as R0, R1, R2 where R0 < R1 < R2. What is the average turnaround time if all the processes are allocated using the SJF scheduling technique?

Consider the following set of processes with the length of the CPU-burst time given in milliseconds. If the FCFS scheduling scheme is used to allocate resources, then what is the average waiting time in milliseconds:

Process  Burst time
P0 6
P1 8
P2 7
P3 3

Consider the following four processes with the length of the CPU-burst time in milliseconds. If preemptive SJF scheduling scheme is used to allocate resources, then what is the average waiting time in milliseconds:

Process Arrival time Burst time
P0 0 8
P1 1 4
P2 2 9
P3 3 5

A Job ‘J’, arrives at an average of ‘n’ jobs per minute and the individual job requires an average of 8 seconds of burst time. If the CPU is busy for 80% of the time, then what is the total number of jobs assigned with resources?
In an operating system, which of the following statements correctly defines the turnaround time in the process scheduling activity?

a.option: It is the time a process spends waiting in the kernel’s ready queue.
It is the time elapsed until the completion of a process.
It is the time elapsed from the period where a request was first submitted until first response is produced.
It is the time taken by a process to enter the ready state from the waiting state.

q: In process scheduling, which of the following queues contains the processes that have been blocked because of the unavailability of I/O devices?
Which of the following statements about the purpose of a ready queue in the process scheduling algorithm is correct?

a.option: To store all processes residing in the main memory which are ready and waiting to execute
To store all the processes in the system
To store all the blocked processes
To store all the terminated processes

q: In an operating system, which of the following two steps are associated with the execution of processes?

In an operating system, which of the following criteria are mandatory to perform the process scheduling:

  1. Maximum CPU utilization
  2. Minimum throughput
  3. Minimum start time
  4. Maximum turnaround time

Using the values in the following table, calculate the average turnaround time by using the non-preemptive Shortest Job First algorithm:   

Process     Arrival time Burst time
P1 0.0 7
P2 2.0 4
P3 4.0 1
P4 5.0 4
In Oracle, which of the following background processes performs recovery at the instance startup if required?

In process scheduling, which of the following statements about the convoy effect phenomenon is correct:

  1. It is associated with the priority scheduling algorithm.
  2. It occurs when multiple processes that have small burst time wait for one long process to finish utilizing the CPU.
  3. It can be avoided by using preemptive scheduling algorithms.  
  4. It can cause a decrease in the processing time and efficiency of the whole operating system.
In an operating system, what is the purpose of the process scheduling technique?
In process scheduling, which of the following statements about the aging technique is correct?

a.option: It is a technique of gradually increasing the priority of processes that are waiting from a long time.
It is a technique to keep a track of the data that is currently residing in memory.
It is a technique to keep a track of the number of times a given page is referenced.
It is a technique to keep a track of cache contents.

q:
In an operating system, when does a CPU scheduler selects a new process to run:

  1. When a running process is blocked
  2. When the timer expires
  3. When a waiting process unblocks
  4. When a process terminates

Consider the following set of processes, assumed to have arrived at time 0, in the order P0, P1,..., P4, with the length of the CPU-burst time given in milliseconds. If the priority scheduling scheme is used to allocate the resources, then what is the average waiting time in milliseconds?

Process Priority Burst time
P0 3 10
P1 1 1
P2 4 2
P3 5 1
P4 2 5
In an operating system, what is the definition of the throughput?

a.option: Number of processes that are completed in a unit of time
Number of threads that are completed in a unit of time
Number of processes that are started in a unit of time
Number of processes that are scheduled in a unit of time

q: If user want to know the number of links available in the system which block he needs to be accessed in UNIX
In an operating system, why are the processes scheduled?
Which of the following APIs is used to schedule jobs in Android?
What is the main objective of the medium-term scheduler in the process scheduling?

a.option: To move processes from the main memory to a disk and vice versa
To control the degree of multiprogramming
To select a process and allocate the CPU for processing that specific task

q:
Consider the following set of processes, assumed to have arrived at time 0 in the order P0, P1,...,P4 with the CPU-burst time given in milliseconds. If FCFS, SJF, and RR (time slice = 10 milliseconds, time slice = 29 milliseconds) scheduling schemes are used to allocate resources, then which of the following algorithms will give you the shortest average waiting time in milliseconds:

Process Burst time
P0 10
P1 29
P2 3
P3 7
P4 12
In process scheduling, which of the following statements correctly defines the waiting time of a process?

a.option: Total time that processes spent in blocked and waiting queues
Total time that processes had spent in the ready queue
Total time that processes had spent in the running queue
Total time that processes had taken from the completion till the submission

q: If user want to know the information about free inode which block he needs to be accessed in UNIX
If user want to know the information about the modification time of inode which block he needs to be accessed in UNIX
If user want to know the information about the size of the file system which block he needs to be accessed in UNIX
